title: Schedule of Ratings - Musculoskeletal System - Knee and Leg
description: Rating criteria for knee and lower leg disabilities

normal_rom.note: Normal knee extension is 0 degrees (leg straight). Flexion is measured from 0 to 140 degrees.

levels.criteria: For 1 year following implantation of prosthesis
With chronic residuals consisting of severe painful motion or weakness in the affected extremity
Minimum rating (with intermediate degrees of residual weakness, pain, or limitation of motion)
Favorable angle in full extension, or in slight flexion between 0 and 10 degrees
Extremely unfavorable, in flexion at an angle of 45 degrees or more

5257.name: Recurrent subluxation or lateral instability
5257.important: Can be rated separately from limitation of motion if both conditions exist

5258.name: Cartilage, semilunar, dislocated
5258.criteria: With frequent episodes of 'locking,' pain, and effusion into the joint
5258.note: Meniscus tear with locking, pain, and joint fluid

5260.name: Limitation of flexion of the leg

5261.name: Limitation of extension of the leg

levels.criteria: Malunion with slight knee or ankle disability
Malunion with moderate knee or ankle disability
Malunion with marked knee or ankle disability
Nonunion, with loose motion, requiring brace

5263.name: Genu recurvatum
5263.criteria: Acquired, traumatic, with weakness and insecurity in weight-bearing objectively demonstrated

allowed_combinations.explanation: Veteran can receive separate ratings for arthritis with limitation of motion AND instability of the same knee

allowed_combinations.description: Separate ratings for limited flexion (5260) + limited extension (5261)
allowed_combinations.explanation: If both flexion and extension are compensably limited, each can be rated separately

not_allowed: Cannot rate under 5257 and 5258 together (instability types)

arthritis_rules.rating_method: Rate based on limitation of motion. If motion is not compensably limited but there is X-ray evidence of arthritis, rate 10% for each major joint or group of minor joints affected.
arthritis_rules.painful_motion: With X-ray evidence of arthritis and painful motion, rate at least 10% under appropriate diagnostic code

important_rules: Limited flexion and extension can be rated separately if both are compensable
Instability can be rated separately from limitation of motion
Both knees should be examined and can be rated separately
Painful motion with X-ray evidence of arthritis warrants at least 10%
DeLuca factors (pain, weakness, fatigability, incoordination) must be considered
Flare-up ROM should be estimated by examiner

key_precedent_decisions.holding: Separate ratings for arthritis with limited motion AND instability of the same knee are permitted
Separate ratings can be assigned for limited flexion (5260) and limited extension (5261) of the same knee when both are compensable
Confirms that 5257 (instability) and 5003/5260/5261 (arthritis with limitation of motion) are based on different symptoms and can be rated separately
